oai_dc:dc.dc:contributor: The New Digital Bleek and Lloyd
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: ||kabbo (Jantje) (II)
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: The Jackal howls and begs the Leopard for springbok flesh for it to eat. The Jackal angers the Leopard which then kills it and places its body in a bush. 1) This story is found in Book II.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Wilhelm Bleek notebooks
oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Leopards and jackals
